The season is in full swing for advertisements from all political parties. So far television ads have been the preferred medium. Bumper stickers are nearly non-existent yet. But yesterday I spotted the first billboard of the campaign.
 
 On a white background with patriotic red and blue lettering: "When Clinton lied, nobody died." 
 
 First, I didn't realize Bill Clinton was running again. Secondly, what pride and inspiration this message must engender in a person with Democratic persuasions. And finally, who is the presumptive nominee and why should I vote for him? 
 
 This is quite possibly the worst ad I have ever seen, and leaves me with the distinct impression that the Democrats have NOTHING to offer.

 ...a foregone conclusion.

...a foregone conclusion.

 OUCH!
 
 Really, but do the Repubs?
 
 I have been on the Republican side more than not, but how is one better than the other as it stands now?
 
 The advertisements really show the party's scruples, which have degenerated far worse than I expected over the last dozen years.

 There's about a dime's worth of difference between Dems and Repubs. 
 
 A Dem is worth two dead flies. 
 
 A Repub is worth two dead flies and a dime. 
 
 Count up all the Repubs and you got yourself a truckload of dimes.

I am King Triton,And I approve this post!
 I wish that both sides would stop with the mud slinging and stick with their own agenda,but then they should be forced to comply with the promises that they make to win an election.The more of this garbage I hear,the more I dont want to vote for either of them.
